business.headline: Delhi Airport gives seed balls to flyers, merges green goals with social impactLed by GMR Aero's Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL), the campaign invites passengers to plant seed balls containing species like Lemon, Tamarind, Gooseberry, Neem, and Peepal, all chosen for their ecological and medicinal value.
Want to update your credit card email? Follow these stepsA guide to updating your registered email address for credit cards in India, highlighting the new RBI KYC norms and simplification by banks.

Tata to handle iPhone and MacBook repairs in India for Apple: ReportAs the US tech giant continues to diversify its manufacturing footprint beyond China, Tata has emerged as a key ally. The group already assembles iPhones at three facilities in southern India, with one also manufacturing certain components.
Will energy replace currency? Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath thinks soNikhil Kamath believes energy could replace money in the next decade. Here's why he thinks so.

Sensex ends over 400 points higher, Nifty above 24,700; Eternal gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 443.79 points to end at 81,442.04, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 130.70 points to close at 24,750.90.

Want ELI scheme benefits? Make sure your UAN and Aadhaar are linked by this dateThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation has extended the deadline for UAN activation and Aadhaar linking to bank accounts under the ELI scheme until 30 June 2025.

Are you a freelancer? 5 things to know while filing your ITRFreelancers can claim deductions for expenses directly related to their work. These include internet bills, rent for a co-working space, cost of software tools, professional fees, marketing and advertising costs, and travel expenses related to business, etc.

GST Council may remove 12% slab, shift items to 5% and 18% tax ratesThe GST Council is considering eliminating the 12% tax slab as part of efforts to streamline the tax structure, potentially moving these items to either the 5% or 18% brackets.

Dr Reddy's shares jump over 3% today. Here's whyDr Reddy's shares soar 3.54% after Alvotech partnership for Keytruda biosimilar, enhancing global reach in cancer immunotherapy and signaling growth potential in competitive biosimilar market.
What is DIGIPIN? India's new digital address system explainedThe Department of Posts has launched DIGIPIN, a geocoded digital address system aiming to improve location accuracy and service delivery.

Eternal shares continue to rally, jumps over 4%. Should you buy?By approximately 10:06 am, the company's shares had risen 4.42% to Rs 256.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). This marks a 12% rise over the past five trading sessions and a 6% increase over the past month. However, year-to-date, the stock remains down by over 7%.
Sensex rallies 800 points: Why is stock market rising today?As of 12:24 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had jumped 770.31 points to reach 81,768.56. The NSE Nifty50 was also up by 230.50 points at 24,850.60.

entertainment.headline: Panchayat Season 4 to arrive early? Manju Devi vs Kranti Devi promo suggests soThe rivalry between Manju Devi and Kranti Devi takes a new twist in the rally cry song of 'Panchayat Season 4'. The video hints at the show releasing ahead of the July 2 launch date.

Ayushmann Khurrana's next with Sooraj Barjatya to go on floors in November: ReportAyushmann Khurrana will play the lead role of 'Prem' in Sooraj Barjatya's next family drama, which begins shooting in November 2025. The film, also starring Sharvari, is expected to release in the second half of 2026.

Farah Khan's cook Dilip shares chocolates with paps before first foreign trip. WatchFarah Khan's in-house cook Dilip is now a social media sensation. He was seen at the airport ahead of his first international trip.

Ranjeet shares birthday fun from Housefull 5 sets: Can't stop missing these momentsVeteran actor Ranjeet recently shared a throwback clip of his birthday celebrations from the sets of Housefull 5. Akshay Kumar, Riteish Deshmukh, Abhishek Bachchan, and others were seen celebrating with him.

Akshay Kumar wasn't the first choice for Jaanwar: Suneel DarshanFilmmaker Suneel Darshan revealed that Akshay Kumar was not the original lead for Jaanwar. The director had initially considered two other Bollywood actors before casting Akshay during a low point in his career.

Aamir Khan confirms superhero film with director Lokesh Kanagaraj. DetailsAamir Khan is set to work with Tamil director Lokesh Kanagaraj for his next superhero film. The actor confirmed the development and the film will go on the floors somewhere in the second half of 2026.

Ishaan Khatter addresses rift with The Royals makers over shirtless scenesActor Ishaan Khatter recently opened up about his rift with 'The Royals' makers over his shirtless scenes. Khatter said that he resisted certain scenes, however, they persisted.

Muzammil Ibrahim says he was in a relationship with Deepika Padukone for 2 yearsActor Muzammil Ibrahim recently revealed he dated Deepika Padukone for two years during their early modelling days in Mumbai. He shared fond memories of their time together, including rickshaw dates and birthday surprises, and expressed admiration for her success today.

Actor Barun Sobti confirms Asur 3 in worksActor Barun Sobti created strong buzz among fans after he gave an update on his popular series 'Asur'. He stated that the third part of the franchise is in the works.

Pankaj Tripathi, Aditi Rao Hydari team up for Parivarik ManuRanjanActors Pankaj Tripathi and Aditi Rao Hydari are set to share the screen space for the first time in Parivarik ManuRanjan. The shooting of the film has begun in Lucknow.

Sitaare Zameen Par: Aamir Khan is a playful coach in fun, slice-of-life title trackThe 'Sitaare Zameen Par' title track was released on June 5. Aamir Khan plays a caring and playful basketball coach in the slice-of-life song celebrating team-spirit and human resilience.

Actor Muzammil Ibrahim accuses Pooja Bhatt of abuse on Dhokha set 18 years agoActor Muzammil Ibrahim recently recalled his unpleasant experience of working under actor-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt's direction. He alleged that due to Pooja's abusive behaviour, he decided not to work with her in the near future.

Kamal Haasan fans defy Thug Life ban in Karnataka, travel 42 km to watch the filmActor Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' was banned in Karnataka following his controversial comment about the Kannada language. However, fans from Bengaluru travelled to Hosur, Tamil Nadu, to watch the film and show their support.

K-pop group X:IN Interview: Indian star Aria teaches her members Hindi, talk Defend MyselfK-pop girl group X:IN sits down with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal for a hilariously unfiltered chat! From opening up about their fierce comeback Defend Myself, to teasing each other, this is unmissable.

8-hour shifts for Bollywood moms? Housefull 5 director Tarun Mansukhani reactsIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Housefull 5 director Tarun Mansukhani said he has no problem with new mothers in Bollywood wanting to do an eight-hour shift, but the demand has to come with prior information.

Chhoti bachi hai kya? in Housefull 5 was spontaneous: Director Tarun MansukhaniDirector Tarun Mansukhani has revealed the dialogue 'Chhoti bachi hai kya' dialogue happened on the spot and wasn't in the script. Housefull 5 will be released on June 6, 2025.

Surveen Chawla on joining Criminal Justice 4 and turning down a big filmSurveen Chawla joins Criminal Justice Season 4, sharing insights on her role choices and experiences. She also reveals turning down a major film to avoid repeating herself as an actor.

Thug Life review: Kamal Haasan, Silambarasan's gangster drama soars, then sinksReleased-Thu Jun 05, 2025Thug Life movie review: Directed by Mani Ratnam, 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, is a gangster drama with emotional beats. While the film had a great set-up pre-interval, it falls into a deep pit in the second half and there is no turning back – even for a legend like Mani Ratnam.

Samjha karo: Arbaaz Khan's request to paps sparks pregnancy buzz about wife SshuraArbaaz Khan and wife Sshura Khan were spotted during a family outing in Mumbai, sparking pregnancy rumours. Arbaaz's request for privacy from paparazzi further hinted at the couple expecting their first child together.

general news.headline: Bengaluru top cop, officials suspended: Siddaramaiah's big action after stampedeKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced the suspension of the Bengaluru Police Commissioner and other top police officials after 11 people died in a deadly stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB's IPL victory celebrations.

Killer factors behind the avoidable Bengaluru stampede. Explained in 5 pointsA celebration meant to honour Royal Challengers Bengaluru's historic win in IPL 2025 turned into a tragedy. The stampede in Bengaluru was a result of a series of ignored warnings and mismanagement. From conflicting announcements to crowd-control failures, these are the five big reasons behind the chaos that led to the tragedy.

Nations sympathise with Pak's poverty but see it as problem child: BJP's Jay PandaSpeaking after the delegation's return, Jay Panda highlighted the warm reception accorded to the Indian MPs and claimed that the countries they visited made a clear distinction between India and Pakistan.

How Tharoor hit Trump, Rahul Gandhi with a single stone on ceasefireTrump's claim of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan has been used by the Congress and its leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, to attack PM Narendra Modi. But why hasn't India vociferously rejected Trump's claim? Congress MP Shashi Tharoor revealed why the Indian government has been diplomatic in rejecting Trump's claims, and destroyed Rahul's arguments too.

Bengaluru stampede, the price fans pay for manufactured loyaltyThe tragic Bengaluru stampede, claiming 11 lives, was not just a failure of crowd control, but a symptom of fan irrationality fuelled by the IPL's corporate exploitation. The catastrophe reveals how corporate greed exploits human psychology, transforming fan loyalty into a tragic loss of reason and lives.

Congress's fresh 'Narender surrender' salvo at PM features Trump's red MAGA cap The fresh salvo came in the form of a social media post featuring US President Donald Trump's iconic red 'Make America Great Again' cap, emblazoned with the words 'Narender Surrender' - a pointed reference to Gandhi's allegation that PM Modi agreed to a ceasefire with Pakistan following a call from Trump.

Bengaluru Police pinning blame of stampede on RCB, organiser, reveal FIR detailsAs per the FIR filed by the Bengaluru police, RCB, organising firm DNA Entertainment and the Karnataka State Cricket Association have been named as key accused in the stampede at Chinnaswamy Stadium that killed 11 and injured many. The FIR blames organisers for negligence and poor crowd control.

Record-setting Chenab Bridge opens tomorrow, Omar Abdullah shares stunning picsPrime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the engineering marvels - Chenab Bridge and Anji Bridge - during his visit to Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. Ahead of his visit, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah shared stunning photos and videos of the two rail bridges.

Thug Life review: Kamal Haasan, Silambarasan's gangster drama soars, then sinksReleased-Thu Jun 05, 2025Thug Life movie review: Directed by Mani Ratnam, 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, is a gangster drama with emotional beats. While the film had a great set-up pre-interval, it falls into a deep pit in the second half and there is no turning back – even for a legend like Mani Ratnam.

Aryna Sabalenka ends Iga Swiatek's dream run, through to maiden finalFrench Open 2025: Aryna Sabalenka stormed into the final of the clay-court major after beating four-time champion Iga Swiatek in three sets on Thursday on Centre Court.

Gambhir on Bengaluru stampede: Never believed we needed roadshows to celebrateIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir called the Bengaluru stampede, which claimed 11 lives and injured nearly 50, a tragic event and said he has always believed that such open-road celebrations are unnecessary.

Big boost to Make in India: Rafale makers, Tata partner for fuselage manufacturingA dedicated facility will be established in Hyderabad to manufacture key structural sections of the aircraft, including the central fuselage, rear section, lateral rear shells and front section.

Reverse Catfishing: Gen Z's new dating strategy for finding real love'Reverse catfishing' is a dating strategy where users intentionally put up unfiltered, raw, and even flawed pictures with purposefully toned-down achievements to find the most genuine match.

Assam-born doctor arrested in US over $150-million scam has troubled historyTonmoy Sharma, a 61-year-old doctor from Guwahati has been arrested in the US over an alleged $149-million healthcare fraud. Sharma moved to the US and founded the Sovereign Health Group after his medical licence was revoked in the UK in 2007 due to research misconduct.

Shashi Tharoor-led delegation meets JD Vance, discusses counter-terrorism effortsThe delegation comprising Bhubaneswar Kalita, Tejasvi Surya, Shiv Sena MP Milind Deora, JMM MP Sarfraz Ahmad and former diplomat Taranjit Singh Sandhu, and Shashi Tharoor met JD Vance on Thursday.

Bengaluru stampede blame game: Where does the buck stop? Democratic Newsroom debatesThe big focus of this episode of Democratic Newsroom is the tragic stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru on Wednesday during Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) team's victory parade after their maiden Indian Premier League (IPL) title win.

OnePlus Pad 3 review: Android tablet that is big on performanceThe Android tablet market can be rather confusing. The OnePlus Pad 3 aims to simplify it all by offering top and high-end hardware and features at a more affordable price. It largely succeeds.

Trump, Xi hold talks amid strained US-China ties over trade disputesChinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump held a phone call amid rising tensions over trade and critical minerals. The call follows a fragile 90-day tariff rollback deal reached in May.

Telangana MBBS student in Vietnam dies after speeding bike crashes into wallA 21-year-old MBBS student from Telangana died after his speeding motorbike crashed into a wall in Vietnam's Can Tho City. A friend riding with the victim sustained severe injuries in the crash.

The Better Sister review: Power, patriarchy and murder in a brilliantly layered showReleased-Thu May 29, 2025'The Better Sister', co-created by Olivia Milch and Regina Corrado, is streaming on Prime Video. The show featuring Jessica Biel and Elizabeth Banks is an intriguing whodunnit with stellar performances.

AI's dirty secret: How your chatbot is draining Earth's water and energyArtificial Intelligence might feel like magic, but it's powered by very real, very energy-hungry machines. Training a single large AI model like GPT-4 can emit as much CO₂ as five cars over their lifetime. Behind every chatbot answer or AI-generated image lies massive server farms, often powered by non-renewable energy sources.

Trinamool MP Mahua Moitra marries former BJD MP Pinaki Misra in ceremony abroadMahua Moitra and BJD leader Pinaki Misra, both sitting Lok Sabha members, have reportedly married in a quiet overseas ceremony.

Teens, dancer, jobseekers: The 11 lives lost in Bengaluru RCB event stampedeFans climbed trees, walls, and gates to enter Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru after mixed messages about the RCB event venue spread. Moments later, a stampede left 11 dead and 47 injured.

How a Mumbai auto driver earns Rs 5–8 lakh monthly without even driving his autoWith no tech, no startup funding, and no formal business plan, this Mumbai auto driver has turned a daily pain point into a Rs 5-8 lakh per month operation.

sports.headline: Aryna Sabalenka ends Iga Swiatek's dream run, through to maiden finalFrench Open 2025: Aryna Sabalenka stormed into the final of the clay-court major after beating four-time champion Iga Swiatek in three sets on Thursday on Centre Court.

Pataudi Trophy renamed Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy for India vs England Tests: ReportThe India and England Test series will reportedly be played for a new trophy named after two cricketing legends, Sachin Tendulkar and James Anderson. Earlier, the winner of the bilateral Test series between India and England was awarded the Pataudi Trophy.

Haven't yet decided on No. 4, Bumrah's workload in England Tests: Gautam GambhirIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir said that no final decision has been made yet regarding Jasprit Bumrah's workload or the No. 4 batting position for the upcoming five-match Test series against England, which begins on June 20.

After F1, 10-year-old Indian racing prodigy gets backing from UAE-based AKCEL GP10-year-old racing prodigy, Atiqa Mir, received a big boost in her fast-growing racing career. AKCEL GP is a high-performance motorsport squad competing in FIA F4 and Formula Regional Middle East Championship besides FIA F3.

Gautam Gambhir hints at Karun Nair's Test return on England tour with extended runGautam Gambhir has hinted at Karun Nair's return to the Indian Test side during the England tour. Karun hit a double hundred while playing for India A against England Lions in a four-day practice game in Canterbury in June.

Gambhir on Bengaluru stampede: Never believed we needed roadshows to celebrateIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir called the Bengaluru stampede, which claimed 11 lives and injured nearly 50, a tragic event and said he has always believed that such open-road celebrations are unnecessary.

Kapil Dev on stampede during RCB IPL bash: Lives more important than celebrationFormer India captain Kapil Dev said both organisers and the public should exercise caution, urging them to prioritise safety over celebration. Eleven were killed and over 40 were injured in a stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Wednesday, June 4.

Satwik and Chirag storm into Indonesia Open quarters as Sindhu exitsSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty kept India's hopes alive at the Indonesia Open with a gritty comeback win, entering the quarterfinals. However, it was a mixed day for the contingent, as PV Sindhu suffered a second-round exit following a hard-fought three-game loss in Jakarta.

Semi-final Live Updates: Gauff vs Boisson underway, Sabalenka knocks out SwiatekFrench Open 2025 Live Updates: It's all over for Iga Swiatek. The four-time champion has lost a match at Roland Garros for the first time since 2021. She has been beaten in three sets by World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka. Coco Gauff is currently taking on Lois Boisson, the wildcard, in the second semi-final.

Shubman Gill won't find Test captaincy easy, needs to work on batting: PontingAustralian great Ricky Ponting believes Shubman Gill still has work to do on his Test batting and, with the added responsibility of leading India on the upcoming tour of England, he would be better off moving down to number four in the batting order.

From fear to fight: Firooza Amiri stands tall for Afghan women's cricketIn an exclusive interview, Firooza Amiri opened up on the challenges faced by the Afghanistan women's cricketers after the Taliban takeover in 2021 and how they fled their motherland and took exile in Australia.

Kapil Dev on stampede during RCB IPL bash: Lives more important than celebrationFormer India captain Kapil Dev said both organisers and the public should exercise caution, urging them to prioritise safety over celebration. Eleven were killed and over 40 were injured in a stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Wednesday, June 4.

However, it was a mixed day for the contingent, as PV Sindhu suffered a second-round exit following a hard-fought three-game loss in Jakarta.

Semi-final Live Updates: Gauff vs Boisson underway, Sabalenka knocks out SwiatekFrench Open 2025 Live Updates: It's all over for Iga Swiatek. The four-time champion has lost a match at Roland Garros for the first time since 2021. She has been beaten in three sets by World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka. Coco Gauff is currently taking on Lois Boisson, the wildcard, in the second semi-final.

Shubman Gill won't find Test captaincy easy, needs to work on batting: PontingAustralian great Ricky Ponting believes Shubman Gill still has work to do on his Test batting and, with the added responsibility of leading India on the upcoming tour of England, he would be better off moving down to number four in the batting order.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
